request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Protected Health Information (form-5)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Advocate Health provides a dedicated 'Patient Request for Health Information' form (form-4) for patient self-access, separate from the third-party authorization, with a prominent callout to the LiveWell patient portal as an online alternative.

red_flags: No fillable fields on a born-digital PDF, forcing a print-and-handwrite workflow
No submission instructions on the patient access form (no address, fax, or email for return)
bright_spots: Dedicated patient self-access form clearly separated from third-party authorization
Portal callout prominently placed at top of form directing patients to LiveWell for online access
Five delivery methods including encrypted email and patient portal
Concise single-page design fitting 22+ record-type checkboxes
Companion instructions document and Spanish-language authorization form available
Recently revised (November 2025) indicating active form maintenance

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms are easy to find via the centralized medical records page (advocatehealth.com/contact-us/medical-records) with direct PDF download links; web searches also surface the forms, though the system-level organization may require an extra step for patients searching by hospital name.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The PDF form has zero fillable fields despite being born-digital, requiring print-and-handwrite; the patient portal (LiveWell) provides a digital alternative, and fax/mail submission is implied but not stated on the form itself — usable digitally with workarounds.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized single-page form with logical flow, three-column checkbox layout, plain language, and 22+ granular record-type options; minor issues include dense packing and vague fee language ('Fees may apply').

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process is designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case — dedicated form titled 'Patient Request for Health Information,' separate from third-party release, with 'Myself' as first recipient option and portal callout prominently at top.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, witness, or in-person requirements; minor ambiguities include vague fee disclosure ('Fees may apply' without amounts), no explicit patient rights statement on the patient access form, and missing submission instructions.

overall.summary: Advocate Good Samaritan Hospital demonstrates strong patient-centeredness through a dedicated self-access form and portal-first messaging, with good findability and content design, held back by a non-fillable PDF and missing submission instructions.
